thread.title_full: Heat Levels: Despite Drizzle, No Respite From Heat In Sight | - Times of India

author: TNN
title: Heat Levels: Despite Drizzle, No Respite From Heat In Sight | - Times of India
text: Hyderabad: Despite rain predictions and light showers recorded last week, a yellow alert for high heat levels is back in force across all districts of state for the next five days. The intensity of the heat spiked on Thursday as the levels shot up to 40°C in Nalgonda. In the GHMC limits, Mettuguda recorded the highest temperature at 37.6°C. Other districts like Bhadrachalam saw a five degree celsius spike in maximum temperatures from 32°C on Wednesday to 37°C on Thursday. Similarly, Hanumakonda, which had recorded 31°C on Wednesday, saw the heat levels go up to 35°C on Thursday.“There is going to be a gradual rise in temperatures throughout next week with one or two heat wave days expected,” said IMD officials.In terms of rainfall, no new spells are expected.tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyDelhi records minimum temperature of 11.9 degree Celsius, IMD predicts cloudy skies todayDelhi had a chilly morning at 11.9C, 5 degrees below normal, with cloudy skies predicted by the India Meteorological Department.
